column5: Just a little fyi... I bought a 5' Coleman bulk propane hose from CT last week, to hook up my 10lb tank to my Mr. Heater... $44.99... (ouch). I was at Princess Auto in Whitby today and bought the same 5' hose, but Mr. Heater brand, for $24.99! Coleman one has now been returned to CT...
I ran into the same thing with my Big buddy heater. Princess Auto is always the way to go.
Quick, run over to your local Wmart, I got a 4' hose about 2 weeks ago for $15, long enough to keep the tank out and the heater in the portable.
Gonna cost more in gas, than the difference, if Pete keeps driving and returning..
Lol... true enough! I was happy enough to save the $20... I was going there anyway to fill my propane tank.
slight redirect but still on propane subject.does anyone know where to find an adaptor to fill 1lb'ers from a 20 lb'er?
Yah... we did that thread before Christmas!  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.p...propane+adapter
Took me about 2 weeks to get the one off Ebay.. 100% legit seller.

MAKE SURE YOU PUT THE FITLER ON THE HEATER IF YOUR RUNNING A HOSE FROM A BULK TANK!!!! THE RUBBER WILL CAUSE YOUR HEATER TO FAIL!!!!!!! YOU CAN GET THE FITER AT PRINCESS AUTO FOR $10. I THOUGHT THAT WAS ALOT OF BULL WHEN I FIRST HEARD IT TILL IT HAPPEND TO ME. AFTER I TOOK THE HEATER APART AND CLEANED IT I LEARNED ITS 100% TRUE. SAFE YOURSELF BEING COLD BUY THE FILTER!!!!!!!!!!!
